name: PiracyVisualizer
tagline: A repository dedicated to visualize the general trends of piracy within territories around the world. A cool visualization that will let you know if piracy is really helping artists get recognition or making them bankrupt
body:
### Welcome to PiracyVisualizer Bill gates once said "Although about 3 million computers get sold every year in China, people don't pay for the software. Someday they will, though," Gates told an audience at the University of Washington. "And as long as they're going to steal it, we want them to steal ours. They'll get sort of addicted, and then we'll somehow figure out how to collect sometime in the next decade." This project supports this fact by visualizing piracy trends in developing countries like India and China to see if piracy really affects or sustains artists development.
Infographic by- GO-Gulf
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
